DOCNAME: CASE OF OLIMPIA-MARIA TEODORESCU v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived in PERSON .

CARDINAL . In DATE , a house and QUANTITY . m of appurtenant land situated in ORG , PERSON no . CARDINAL , the property of the applicant ’s parents , were seized by GPE no . CARDINAL on nationalisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant claimed compensation for the property under PERSON no . LANGUAGE . She states that she has not received any compensation .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date the property was divided into several parts . It appears from the documents in the file that the property , made up of CARDINAL constructions and appurtenant land , was divided into CARDINAL apartments and CARDINAL plots of appurtenant land of QUANTITY . m and QUANTITY . m respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE , and DATE and DATE the ORG sold the CARDINAL apartments to the then tenants . It appears from the file that the CARDINAL plots of appurtenant land were not made the object of a sale .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG by a final decision allowed the applicant ’s action for annulment of the ORG ’s title to property , acknowledged that the nationalisation of the building and of the QUANTITY . m of land appurtenant to it had been unlawful and ordered restoration in the name of the applicant ’s parents .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the court to find that the sales by the ORG on DATE and DATE of apartments nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL respectively , situated on PERSON no . CARDINAL , were null and void . According to the applicant , she did not request the annulment of the sale of the other apartments , considering the action pointless in so far as the constant practice was to dismiss this kind of action .

On DATE and on DATE respectively ORG by final decisions dismissed the CARDINAL actions by the applicant to declare null and void the sales by the ORG . The court considered that the sales had complied with the provisions of PERSON no . NORP and that the former tenants had made the purchase in good faith .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made CARDINAL different requests under the PERSON no . CARDINAL governing immovable property wrongfully seized by the ORG , seeking restitution in kind or compensation of the parts of her property situated in GPE , PERSON nos . CARDINAL and DATE and of the appurtenant land .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , by CARDINAL decisions , proposed that the applicant be given compensation under PERSON no . DATE . ORG mentioned that the apartments and the land claimed in kind were in the possession of third parties .
So far , she has not received any compensation .

CARDINAL . The relevant legal provisions and jurisprudence are described in the judgments ORG v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINALVII ) ; PERSON and Others v. GPE ( no . MONEY , § § DATE , ORG CARDINALVII ) ; ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) ; and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE .
